meanings.definition: A ruler with total power over a country, typically one who has obtained control by force.
meanings.sent1: The dictators in the history books were feared by their people.
meanings.sent2: The dictators of ancient Rome held immense power over their subjects.
meanings.sent3: The dictators at the costume party were dressed in elaborate robes and crowns.
meanings.sent4: The dictators of fashion dictate what is trendy and what is not.
meanings.sent5: The dictators of taste decide what flavors are popular each season.

meanings.definition: A person who tells others what to do in an autocratic way.
meanings.sent1: The strict teacher was known as a dictator in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The office manager was often seen as a dictator by the employees.
meanings.sent3: The dictator of the household insisted on a strict cleaning schedule.
meanings.sent4: The dictator of the book club always chose the reading selections without input.
meanings.sent5: The dictator of the group project assigned tasks without discussion.
